IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO BROADEN THE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE EAST-WEST CENTER.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO BROADEN THE FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF THE CENTER FOR CULTURAL & TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETWEEN EAST & WEST, INC. (EAST-WEST CENTER) A PUBLIC EDUCATIONAL NON-PROFIT CORPORATION. THE EAST-WEST CENTER LOCATED AT 1601 EAST-WEST ROAD, HONOLULU, HI 96848 IS A NATIONAL EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION CREATED PURSUANT TO PUBLIC LAW 86-472 ENACTED BY THE U.S. CONGRESS. THE FUNDS PROVIDED TO THE EAST-WEST CENTER ARE USED TO PROMOTE BETTER RELATIONS AND UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND NATIONS OF THE ASIA PACIFIC THROUGH COOPERATIVE STUDY, TRAINING AND RESEARCH.
IRS990.Desc: GRANTS TO THE EAST-WEST CENTER ARE USED TO PROMOTE BETTER RELATIONS AND UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE NATIONS OF THE ASIA PACIFIC THROUGH COOPERATIVE STUDY, TRAINING, AND RESEARCH (66 GRANTS)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS IN FILED RETURNS THAT REQUIRE DISCLOSURE IN THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN REMAINDER TRUST
PROVIDE GRANTS TO CENTER FOR CULTURAL AND TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETWEEN EAST AND WEST, INC. A RELATED 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT CORPORATION.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CENTER FOR CULTURAL AND TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETWEEN EAST AND WEST INC

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: PROMOTE BETTER RELATIONS AND UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE NATIONS OF THE ASIA PACIFIC THROUGH COOPERATIVE STUDY, TRAINING, AND RESEARCH.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPENDITURES OF GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED BY THE OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION THROUGH BUDGETARY ACCOUNTS AND MONTHLY EXPENDITURE REPORTS FROM THE GRANT RECIPIENT

A DISCRETIONARY SPENDING AMOUNT FOR REPRESENTATION PURPOSES, HOUSING ALLOWANCE, CAR ALLOWANCE, AND MEMBERSHIP IN THE PACIFIC CLUB IS PROVIDED BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION TO THE PRESIDENT. PREMIUM TRAVEL AND PHONE ALLOWANCES MAY BE PROVIDED TO THE RELATED ORGANIZATION'S EMPLOYEES. TRAVEL POLICIES ADHERE TO THE U.S. FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TRAVEL POLICIES AND GUIDELINES. HOUSING, CAR, AND PHONE ALLOWANCES ARE TREATED AS TAXABLE COMPENSATION.

THE ORGANIZATION RELIED ON A RELATED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, THE CENTER FOR CULTURAL AND TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETWEEN EAST AND WEST, DBA EAST-WEST CENTER, TO ESTABLISH THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION, WHICH IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNERS' EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCOUNTING PREPARES AND REVIEWS THE TAX RETURN. THE TREASURER REVIEWS THE RETURN AND A CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM PERFORMS THE FINAL REVIEW. A PORTAL HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED TO ENABLE ALL BOARD MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX RETURN PRIOR TO IT BEING FILED WITH THE IRS. A FINAL COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD VIA THE PORTAL PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ANNUAL SURVEY IS SENT TO OFFICERS AND BOARD MEMBERS REQUESTING DISCLOSURE OF ANY FAMILY AND BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS AND TRANSACTIONS OR OTHER TRANSACTIONS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS OF INTERESTS. BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE REAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS AT THE TIME WHEN SUCH CONFLICTS ARISE. TRANSACTIONS THAT MAY POSE A POTENTIAL CONFLICT MUST BE DISCLOSED TO, AND MAY BE ENTERED INTO ONLY WITH, THE AUTHORIZATIONS, APPROVAL, OR RATIFICATION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ITS MEMBERS, OR A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. INTERESTED PERSON(S) MUST DISCLOSE THE NATURE OF THEIR INTEREST. THE TRANSACTION SHALL BE AUTHORIZED, APPROVED, OR RATIFIED ONLY WITH THE MAJORITY AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF DIRECTORS WITH NO DIRECT OR INDIRECT INTEREST IN THE TRANSACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION, WHICH IS PAID BY THE EAST-WEST CENTER, A RELATED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION, FOR ALL EMPLOYEES INCLUDING OFFICERS AND KEY AND HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES FOLLOWS THE FEDERAL OFFICE OF PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT CLASSIFICATIONS AND PAY SCALES TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE. THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ITEMS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AND VIA OTHER PUBLIC WEBSITES.
CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN REMAINDER TRUST. -3,216.

AS A PART OF THE REVIEW PROCESS FOR THE FORM 990, CAREFUL SCRUTINY WAS GIVEN TO SCHEDULE A AND IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT 1) THE ORGANIZATION HAD NOT BEEN PROPERLY INCLUDING CONTRIBUTIONS FROM MEMBERS OF THEIR BOARD OF DIRECTORS ON SCHEDULE A, PART III, SECTION A, LINE 7A AND 2) THE ORGANIZATION HAD NOT BEEN PROPERLY REPORTING THE AMOUNT OF INTEREST, DIVIDENDS, RENTS, ROYALTIES AND OTHER SIMILAR SOURCES ON SCHEDULE A, PART III, SECTION B, LINE 10A. THE ORGANIZATION HAD BEEN INCLUDING BOTH CAPITAL GAINS AND LOSSES AND CAPITAL GAIN DISTRIBUTIONS IN SCHEDULE A, PART III, SECTION B, LINE 10A. THE INFORMATION FOR ALL FIVE YEARS TOOK SOME TIME TO GATHER. AS SUCH, THE ORGANIZATION IS AMENDING TO PROPERLY REFLECT THESE ITEMS. CHANGES PART VIII, LINE 4 REMOVED, WITH $417,227 OF INTEREST AND DIVIDENDS MOVED TO LINE 3 AND $71,320 OF LONG TERM CAPITAL GAIN MOVED TO LINE 7A COLUMN (I) SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 7A MODIFIED TO INCLUDE AMOUNTS RECEIVED FROM 2017 - 2021 FROM THEIR BOARD OF DIRECTORS SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 10A MODIFIED TO EXCLUDE CAPITAL GAINS AND LOSSES AND CAPITAL GAIN DISTRIBUTIONS FOR 2017 - 2021. THE EFFECT OF THESE CHANGES WAS TO CHANGE SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 17 FROM 34.07% TO 32.40%, MEANING THAT THE ORGANIZATION PASSED THE NOT MORE THAN 33 1/3% INVESTMENT INCOME TEST.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CENTER FOR CULTURAL AND TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETW

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BENEFIT THE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITES & PROGRAMS OF THE EWC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CENTER FOR CULTURAL AND TECHNICAL INTERCHANGE BETWEEN EAST & WEST IS NOT A CONTROLLED ENTITY OF THE EAST-WEST CENTER FOUNDATION. THEREFORE, IT IS NOT NECESSARY TO REPORT THE AMOUNTS INVOLVED FOR LINE 1. ALTHOUGH THE EAST-WEST CENTER FOUNDATION TRUST IS A CONTROLLED ENTITY OF THE EAST-WEST CENTER FOUNDATION, ALL REVENUES AND EXPENSES OF THE TRUST ARE REPORTED ON THE FOUNDATION'S RETURN.
